com.model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.model.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    The complete game model, containing the locations of all enemies and objects, as well as the current statistics of the player, as well as the room layout. This is automatically generated
    Author:
    Christopher

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Model()
      Constructs a fresh game model, with no data yet stored.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setLayout(FloorLayout layout) 
      void setPlayer(Player player)
      Sets the current active player.
      void setView(GUI view)
      Causes the model, and all sub-elements of the model, to begin sending messages and notifications to the specified view object.
      void showCharacterSelection()
      Sets up the related View with the appropriate options for the player to select a class.
      void showCombatControls()
      Sets the view to display controls for the player to engage in combat.
      void showMovementControls()
      Sets the view to display controls for the player to move between available rooms.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model()
        Constructs a fresh game model, with no data yet stored.

    • Method Detail

      • showCharacterSelection

        public void showCharacterSelection()
        Sets up the related View with the appropriate options for the player to select a class. This will construct a button for each currently available class, and provide some dialogue.

      • showCombatControls

        public void showCombatControls()
        Sets the view to display controls for the player to engage in combat. If the view is set to null, does nothing.

      • showMovementControls

        public void showMovementControls()
        Sets the view to display controls for the player to move between available rooms. If the view is set to null, does nothing.

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Player player)
        Sets the current active player.
        Parameters:
        player - player object to be set at the current active player.

      • setLayout

        public void setLayout(FloorLayout layout)
        Parameters:
        layout - the layout for the currently active floor.

      • setView

        public void setView(GUI view)
        Causes the model, and all sub-elements of the model, to begin sending messages and notifications to the specified view object.
        Parameters:
        view - GUI to be sent notifications.
